decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Prossh, Skyraider of Kher, Food Chain, and various mana dorks to generate infinite creature tokens and mana. The key strategy is to ramp quickly with mana acceleration cards like Farseek and Birds of Paradise, while using tutors like Demonic Tutor to find combo pieces. Once the combo is assembled, Prossh can be cast repeatedly with the help of Food Chain to create an army of Kobold tokens and generate infinite mana. Other cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Purphoros, God of the Forge provide additional win conditions by buffing your creatures or dealing damage directly to opponents. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its explosive combo potential.

The deck revolves around generating a large number of creature tokens through Prossh's ability and then using various combo pieces to create a huge amount of mana. This mana is then utilized to cast powerful spells and creatures, such as Craterhoof Behemoth, to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes various utility cards like removal spells and card draw to ensure consistency and resilience. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they can mount a defense. Additionally, cards like Contamination and Purphoros, God of the Forge can deal incremental damage or disrupt the opponent's resources to further secure the win.

The deck revolves around utilizing Azami, Lady of Scrolls as the commander to draw cards and control the game. The strategy is to control the board with counterspells and bounce spells, while generating card advantage through Azami's ability to tap wizards for card draw. The deck includes a high number of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect Azami. The win condition is to either overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and control the board until they run out of resources, or to assemble a combo with cards like Mind Over Matter or Laboratory Maniac. The key is to carefully manage resources and make efficient use of card draw and removal options.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Maelstrom Wanderer as the commander to control the game through a combination of ramp, card draw, and removal spells. The deck aims to ramp quickly into big threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan, while also using control elements such as counterspells and sweepers like All Is Dust and Pyroclasm to slow down opponents. The deck also includes extra turns spells like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation to gain an advantage in the late game. Overall, the strategy is to outvalue opponents by efficiently ramping and controlling the board until the late game where big threats can take over and secure the win.

This deck focuses on generating high levels of mana quickly to play powerful creatures and spells, while also controlling the board through counterspells and removal. It aims to put pressure on opponents early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. Jenara, Asura of War serves as a versatile and powerful commander, able to grow in power over time while also providing a strong flying threat. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures, powerful equipment, and versatile spells to handle a variety of situations. By combining aggressive early plays with strong control elements, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Karador, Ghost Chieftain's ability to recur creatures from the graveyard and create a powerful combo engine. By efficiently filling the graveyard with creatures and using various tutoring and card draw effects, the deck aims to assemble combos that provide value, disruption, and win conditions. The mana base is tuned for consistency and includes key lands like Gaea's Cradle and Cavern of Souls to support the strategy. The creature selection is diverse, covering utility, synergy, and combo pieces such as Reveillark and Karmic Guide. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently utilize the graveyard as a resource and leverage Karador's abilities to create a resilient and potent combo engine.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The commander, Nin, the Pain Artist, can be used to draw cards while dealing damage to creatures. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells like Counterflux, Force of Will, and Mana Leak to stop the opponent's spells. It also has removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Anger of the Gods, and All Is Dust to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and maintaining control of the game until it can win with powerful spells or creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful abilities of Scion of the Ur-Dragon to tutor for dragons from the deck and reanimate them for explosive plays. With a focus on aggressive strategies and maximizing the potential of dragons, the deck includes a range of powerful creatures such as Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Terastodon. In addition, the deck includes a variety of spells to support this strategy, including reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate, as well as control elements like Counterspell and Swords to Plowshares. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth mana fixing and ramp, allowing for consistent and impactful plays throughout the game.
